alert.note: Alert for Randolph; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 3:29PM CDT until July 05 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, Randolph and Saint Clair. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM CDT, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen according to emergency management and radar estimates. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Athens, Marissa and Lenzburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
